context_of_use: This use case allows patients and receptionists to create and manage patient appointments via various devices.
description: Allow patients and receptionists to create and manage patient appointments via various devices.
triggering_event: A receptionist or patient initiates the appointment scheduling process.
preconditions: The user is logged into the system.
The user has the necessary permissions to schedule appointments.
postconditions: An appointment is successfully scheduled and recorded in the system.
assumptions: Patients have access to the system via personal computers or mobile devices.
Receptionists have the necessary training to use the scheduling system.
requirements_met: The system shall allow receptionists to schedule appointments.
The system shall allow patients to schedule appointments online.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on appointment scheduling rules and constraints.
main_flow: 1. Receptionist selects 'Schedule Appointment' → System displays appointment scheduling interface.
2. Receptionist enters patient details and appointment time → System confirms appointment details.
3. Receptionist submits the appointment → System records the appointment and notifies the patient.
4. Patient selects 'Schedule Appointment' → System displays appointment scheduling interface.
5. Patient enters appointment details → System confirms appointment details.
6. Patient submits the appointment → System records the appointment and notifies the receptionist.
